conclusion: Area of the coil ABCO is 0.4 m^2, magnetic field B is 0.1 T along the positive x-axis, initial position of coil is in x-z plane with normal along positive y-axis, coil rotates 60° downward around z-axis, goal is to find change in magnetic flux.

Magnetic flux (Φ) through a surface is given by Φ = B ⋅ A ⋅ cosθ, where B is magnetic field strength, A is area of coil, θ is angle between magnetic field and normal to coil’s surface. Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ = Φ_final - Φ_initial.
Initial magnetic flux Φ_initial is 0 because angle θ_initial between magnetic field and normal to coil is 90°, so cos(90°) = 0.
Coil rotates 60° downward around z-axis, meaning rotation in x-y plane. Initially normal is along +y-axis, 60° rotation downward implies counterclockwise rotation around z-axis.
New normal vector after rotation is (-√3/2, 1/2, 0) after rotating 60° counterclockwise around z-axis.
Calculate angle θ_final between magnetic field and new normal using dot product: cosθ_final = -√3/2.
Final magnetic flux Φ_final is -0.02√3 Wb, approximately -0.03464 Wb.
Change in magnetic flux ΔΦ is -0.02√3, approximately -0.03464 Wb. Magnitude of change is 0.02√3, approximately 0.03464 Wb.
Final answer: change in magnetic flux through coil is approximately 0.0346 Wb.
